title: How to Clear Twitter Cache on Android, iPhone & iPad

steps.title: Open the Twitter app on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open the Twitter app on your iPhone or iPad. It's the blue and white bird icon on your Home screen or in your app list.

steps.title: Tap your profile photo.
steps.content: Tap your profile photo. You'll see it at the top-left corner of the screen. This displays the left sidebar, which contains several options.

steps.title: Tap Settings and privacy.
steps.content: Tap Settings and privacy . This is at the bottom of the left sidebar, but you might have to scroll down a little to see it. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Accessibility, display, and languages.
steps.content: Tap Accessibility, display, and languages . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Data usage.
steps.content: Tap Data usage . It'll be at the bottom of the list. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Media storage.
steps.content: Tap Media storage . This is the first of two different storage options at the bottom of the screen. Media storage contains cached versions of the media files you scroll by, such as photos and animated GIFs.

steps.title: Tap Clear media storage and then confirm.
steps.content: Tap Clear media storage and then confirm. Once you tap this option, a confirmation menu will appear. Tap Clear media storage a second time to confirm. [4] X Research source Once you've cleared your media storage, the Twitter app will take you back to the "Data usage" screen.

steps.title: Tap Web storage.
steps.content: Tap Web storage . This option is at the bottom, beneath your now-empty media storage. Web storage is a cache of cookies, websites, saved passwords, and other web-based data saved to your device while you've used the Twitter app.

steps.title: Choose which web data to delete.
steps.content: Choose which web data to delete. Neither of these options will log you out of Twitter or affect your Safari or Chrome data , but they both have unique functions: [5] X Research source Clear web page storage only deletes cached websites from the Twitter app, but keeps cookies and saved logins on your phone or tablet. Clear all web storage deletes your entire web-related cache, including cookies and website passwords you've saved within Twitter's built-in browser. If you've visited websites through the Twitter app and saved your logins, you'll need to log in next time you visit that site through the app.

steps.title: Tap Clear web page storage or Clear all web storage again to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Clear web page storage or Clear all web storage again to confirm. This instantly clears the selected web cache and frees up space on your iPhone or iPad. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Open your Android's Settings .
steps.content: Open your Android's Settings . The Twitter app on your Android doesn't have a built-in option for clearing cache, but you can easily get the job done from within your Android's Settings. [7] X Research source You'll find your Android's Settings app in your app list. You can also get there by swiping down from the top of the Home screen and tapping the gear icon.

steps.title: Tap the Apps menu.
steps.content: Tap the Apps menu. This expands a list of apps installed on your Android. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Twitter app.
steps.content: Tap the Twitter app. If you don't see it, you can search for it or tap See all apps. On some Android versions, you'll need to tap Manage apps to view your app list.

steps.title: Tap Storage (Samsung Galaxy) or Storage and cache (other versions).
steps.content: Tap Storage (Samsung Galaxy) or Storage and cache (other versions). Because all versions of Android are a little different, you might see a little variation on the wording here. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Clear cache.
steps.content: Tap Clear cache . If you don't see this option, tap the Cache option firstâ€”you should see it then. Once you tap Clear cache , your Twitter web and data cache will clear instantly, freeing up space on your Android. [10] X Research source If you don't see the Clear cache option, you might have to tap Clear data to reveal more options. However, if you do see "Clear Cache" and "Clear data," don't tap that "Clear data" option unless you want to reset the Twitter app to its original settings. Otherwise, you'll be signed out of the Twitter app.
